message: Any one tried "xamarin" or any service like it =Develop for many mobile platforms using one technology - can  tell me  is it Reliable ؟

data.message: I have not tried it myself, but my company as a whole is heavily investing in it with many clients and seeing tremendous success. The guys in Xamarin are so smart and doing their job very well, with inside support from equally smart people at Microsoft, so, the result product really reflects that.

it`s awesome i tried the student licence , it`s simply works to compile your c# code to the java or objective c  code , the result is run a real native app . but it`s dependent on your architecture of app if you need a huge application i recommend xamarin but a note (the apk will be huge with xamarin ), if  u need a small app use (phoneGap or intel XDK ) but it`s run on HTML viewer , finally you should try the new android studio it`s really very good i amazed

Actually I was about to ask this question .. I have a server/client mobile app all data coming from the server .. Is Xamarin that good  when it comes to performance .. I had a very bad experience with phoneGap since when I hate cross-browser approaches?!
Xamarin performance is very good in terms of performance, especially compared to PhoneGap

so xamarin is like writing the same code and compile it for different platforms?
one code => 2 native apps?
Unless you use the recently released "Xamarin Forms" you'll still ned to write the UI code in the native environment.
I guess I'll give it a try xD
